DOC.brief_summary: Liposomal bupivacaine or placebo will be administered at the end of a transobturator midurethral sling to determine if there is a difference in a patient's perceived postoperative pain.
DOC.brief_title: Impact of Liposomal Bupivacaine Administered Following Placement of a Transobturator Suburethral Sling
DOC.detailed_description: The investigators aim to evaluate the use of liposomal bupivacaine to reduce postoperative pain from placement of transobturator slings for the treatment of stress urinary incontinence.
DOC.criteria: Adults > 18 years of age Planning for outpatient surgical treatment of SUI with placement of a transobturator suburethral sling under general anesthesia Pregnant or nursing Allergy to bupivacaine History of drug/alcohol abuse Severe cardiovascular, hepatic, renal disease, or neurological impairmentÂ° Longacting opioid within 3 days or any opioid use within 24 hours before surgery Contraindication to: acetaminophen oxycodone nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drugs (NSAID) Administration of an investigational drug within 30 days before study Chronic pain syndromes Daily NSAID/opioid use Patients having concomitant procedures or not undergoing general anesthesia Patients who require a concomitant anterior repair or urethrocele repair will not be excluded as this requires the same dissection in the anterior vaginal wall.
